title: Parents of Two Oxford High School Students Sue District Over Shooting
sub_head: Two $100 million lawsuits come a week after four students died in mass shooting
body:
The parents of a student shot in the neck during a mass shooting at her Michigan high school last week are filing two $100 million lawsuits against the district and several administrators and staff, a lawyer for the family said.
The lawsuits come just over a week after the accused shooter opened fire on his classmates at Oxford High School in suburban Detroitâ€”an attack that left four students dead as well as six other students and one teacher injured. Michigan-based attorney Geoffrey Fieger filed one $100 million lawsuit in federal court Thursday and plans to file a second lawsuit in state court, according to his assistant.
